SEARCH
Package bg.tu_varna.sit.a1.f22621621.utils

Class GrammarUtils

java.lang.Object
bg.tu_varna.sit.a1.f22621621.utils.GrammarUtils
public class GrammarUtils extends Object
The type GrammarUtils. It containts methods that are used in the implementation of multiple commands and contains the necessary String arrays that define the terminals and nonterminals that are used in the application.

  • Constructor Details

    • GrammarUtils

      public GrammarUtils()
      Instantiates a new GrammarUtils object.

  • Method Details

    • getAllTerminals

      public String[] getAllTerminals()
      Returns the String array of all terminals. The terminals are all lowercase letters from a-z and the numbers from 0-9.
      Returns:
      String array that contains all terminals.

    • getAllNonterminals

      public String[] getAllNonterminals()
      Returns the String array of all nonterminals. The nonterminals are all uppercase letters from A-Z.
      Returns:
      String array that contains all nonterminals.

    • getNextNonterminal

      public String getNextNonterminal(Set<Rule> rules, String[] allNonterminals)
      Returns the next free nonterminal String from all nonterminals. Creates a Map that contains all nonterminals and if they are already used. If a Grammar already has Rules that contain the nonterminals A,B,C and D the next free nonterminal is E.
      Parameters:
      rules - all rules of the grammar
      allNonterminals - all nonterminals
      Returns:
      String - the next free nonterminal which is an uppercase letter

    • countFreq

      public static int countFreq(String pat, String txt)
      Counts the frequency of a pattern String in another text String .
      Parameters:
      pat - the pattern
      txt - the text
      Returns:
      int - the number of times the pattern is contained in the text

    • charsCount

      public int charsCount(String terminal, String[] characters)
      Counts the number of times elements of a characters String array are present in a terminal String.
      Parameters:
      terminal - the terminal String
      characters - the characters String array
      Returns:
      int - the number of occurrences

    • powerset

      public static LinkedHashSet<String> powerset(String[] set)
      Returns the power set from the given set by using a binary counter Example: S = {a,b,c} P(S) = {[], [c], [b], [b, c], [a], [a, c], [a, b], [a, b, c]}
      Parameters:
      set - String[]
      Returns:
      LinkedHashSet

    • intToBinary

      public static String intToBinary(int binary, int digits)
      Converts the given integer to a String representing a binary number with the specified number of digits For example when using 4 digits the binary 1 is 0001
      Parameters:
      binary - int
      digits - int
      Returns:
      String

    • getNewCombinations

      public ArrayList<String> getNewCombinations(String terminal, String removedEmpty, String[] allNonterminals)
      Retuns a String ArrayList that contains all new combinations that are derived of a terminal String using powerset of all nonterminals in the terminal. Removes the combinations that contain the removedEmpty nonterminal. Then it combines the nonterminals and terminals that are contained in the terminal in their normal order.
      Parameters:
      terminal - the terminal String
      removedEmpty - a nonterminal String of a Rule that contains an empty terminal
      allNonterminals - the allNonterminals String set
      Returns:
      the String ArrayList - that contains the combinations

    • isTerminalInNormalForm

      public boolean isTerminalInNormalForm(String terminal)
      Checks if a terminal String is in Chomsky Normal Form. A terminal is in normal form when the terminal is either a single lowercase letter or two uppercase letters.
      Parameters:
      terminal - the terminal String
      Returns:
      boolean - true or false

    • isRuleTerminalsInNormalForm

      public boolean isRuleTerminalsInNormalForm(ArrayList<String> terminals)
      Checks if all terminals of a Rule are in Chomsky Normal Form. Returns true if the count of the terminals in normal form are equal to the count of all terminals of the Rule.
      Parameters:
      terminals - the terminals of the rule
      Returns:
      boolean - true or false

    • getNonterminalKeyFromMap

      public int getNonterminalKeyFromMap(String nonterminal, Map<Integer,String> nonterminalsNumbered)
      Returns the number of the nonterminal from the nonterminalsNumbered Map. The map contains all nonterminals of a Grammar with their index numbers. The nonterminal of the first Rule of the Grammar has the number 1, the nonterminal of the second Rule of the Grammar has the number 2 and so on.
      Parameters:
      nonterminal - the nonterminal
      nonterminalsNumbered - the nonterminalsNumbered Map
      Returns:
      the number of the nonterminal String

    • printStepRules

      public void printStepRules(Set<Rule> rules)
      Appends the String representation of all Rules of a Set and prints it out. Used to display each step of the algorithm that transforms a Grammar in Chomsky Normal Form.
      Parameters:
      rules - the Rules Set

    • getCommonNonterminals

      public Set<String> getCommonNonterminals(Set<Rule> grammar1Rules, Set<Rule> grammar2Rules)
      Finds the shared nonterminals between two Grammars.
      Parameters:
      grammar1Rules - the Rules of the first Grammar
      grammar2Rules - the Rules of the second Grammar
      Returns:
      a String Set containing the common nonterminals
